did.head: Descriptive Summary

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Wise-Ware Family Papers, Manuscript MS 80.5, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Whether or not either of these families ever resided in Williamsburg, and if so, for how long, has not been ascertained. Though, it is thought that Elizabeth Wise resided in Williamsburg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Personal and business papers of the Wise and Ware families. Included among the papers are a letter from Parkes Slater in Williamsburg to William S. Ware concerning the unpaid taxes of his sister, Elizabeth [Ware] Wise; also includes a letter from E. H. Levetz in Williamsburg to Mrs. Wise offering to purchase part of a lot "next to Dick Christian's" owned by her and by Mr. Ware's children; and a letter from W[illiam] S. Ware to his sister, Elizabeth C. Wise, in Williamsburg. Also includes a letter from Elizabeth Wise to Sally [?] mentioning the weddings of Lucy and Sarah Welsh and a trip to Richmond. Business papers include a store account and a tuition receipt.

did.unittitle: Letter. Elizabeth Wise to Sally re family, a wedding, and a visit to Richmond to a tavern, November 1846.
Receipt for part of the tuition for Mrs. B. Wise's daughter. Signed by S.M. Allen, 21 December 1854.

Letter. W[illiam] S. Ware, Churchview, Virginia to Elizabeth C. Ware, Williamsburg. Explains that children and slaves are sick, wishes to hear from her and invites her to spend the winter with him, August 1855.
Receipt of Mrs. E[lizabeth] Wise for items purchased from Robert Barnham, March-December 1856.
Letter. Slater Parkes, Williamsburg, to W[illiam] S. Ware re tax payment due, 30 April 1858.
Letter. E.H. Levetz, Williamsburg to Eliz[abeth] Wise re purchase of property owned by Mrs. Wise and [William] Ware, 29 March 1871.
